title: Body found in search for missing photographer
text:
Keith Morris, 61, went missing on October 3 (Picture: Dyfed-Powys Police)

A body has been found in the sea during the search for missing photographer Keith Morris, 61.

The freelance press and wedding photographer, from Aberystwyth, was last seen and spoken to on Thursday lunchtime, and was reported missing the next day.

Emergency services were then called to Borth beach, in Ceredigion, at around 9.30am on Saturday October, 5.

The Welsh Ambulance Service sent two ambulances to the incident after the coastguard notified them of the discovery of a body in the water.

However the service confirmed that no one was taken to hospital.

Rescue teams and RNLI crews from Aberystwyth , Borth and New Quay also attended the scene, while a rescue helicopter from Caernarfon was also involved.

A spokeswoman for Dyfed-Powys Police said: ‘Formal identification has not yet taken place, however next of kin is aware of the development.’

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
description: A body has been found in the sea during the search for missing photographer Keith Morris.
